alert.note: Alert for Mountrail (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 5:54PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL MOUNTRAIL COUNTY THROUGH 630 PM CDT... At 553 PM CDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 6 miles north of Van Hook Park, or 19 miles south of Stanley, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Mountrail County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
